title: If you didn't select the champion you wanted to play with, and I banned him without noticing.....
body: You have no rights to be pissed at me. You were just asking for it by not cooperating with us about your picks.

replies.body: People don't show their pick intent because others just ban their Champion. Pick intent in itself is a pretty toxic part of champ select.

> [{quoted}](name=MadKnife IV,realm=EUW,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=vVrFAjAU,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-02-05T06:57:31.619+0000)
>
> People don't show their pick intent because others just ban their Champion. Pick intent in itself is a pretty toxic part of champ select.

No it's part of the player base. The player base chooses what to do with the tools RIOT gives us and most times it's to exploit them and be a dickhead. It has nothing whatsoever to do with the way champ select was implemented.
Then just pick a different champ than you intend on playing if you are scared that they may be banned intentionally.
This leads to the OPs problem.

The proposed solution I made was for people intentionally banning what you (anyone, not you personally) picked.  Pick intent is not toxic.  The people abusing it and banning the champ are toxic.

For the OP issue, they can communicate not to ban a certain champ.
Sometimes they prefer not to pick anyone at all either because there's a chance his teammates bans him for fun, or he's just lazy.
Or if it is like Jhin, then the other team may pick it before the 3rd -5th person on your team does.  Better to ban an OP pick than let it go to the opposing team.

As if Jhin is OP. Honestly, for releases, he's not horrible.

Don't get me wrong, he's definitely strong, and once people learn him he will need nerfs, but until then, he's ok-ish.
On the other hand though, people see something they don't like on their team and ban it away from their teammates all the time, so that kind of behavior is a learned response.
{{champion:202}} is the only reasonable champion that allies ban from their teammates(in Rank games).
